intro: Setachna collina, commonly known as the slender setachna, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a mild, spicy fragrance. It is often grown for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
